result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas R. Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of the 3/7/14 Plea & Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Randy R. Koschnick-Transcript held in case 14CF24

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF24 & 14CF66 called together at 2:20 pm
Defendant Thomas R. Bass in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF66: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Both Cases: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Bass waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-14CF24 & Ct#1-14CF66; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
  On Motion of the State, the Court modifies complaint in 14CF24 to reflect a date of 1/5/14 line 1, paragraph 2, factual basis rather than 1/5/13 Sentencing Arguments by ADA Hall - Recess: 2:34 pm for Atty Svehlek to address another matter. Reconvene: 2:59 pm

14CF24: Court sentences Mr. Bass to 3.5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least 1x/mth upon release from prison)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--Reimburse $250 drug testing fee
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

No Driver's License Suspension or Revocation
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

14CF66: Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, consecutive to 14CF24, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--Letter of apology to Dawn Bass, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

0 days credit for time served
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given 
Recess: 3:09 pm
